author: holiman
content: <@!364458974906548225> somewhere, you asked about access to a node? If you give me an ssh key, I can fix that (it's not an archive node though)

author: pipermerriam
content: <@211091239112671234> it was for some of the program participants documenting the tracing apis. I'll let them chime in here, don't recall specifically who needed access.

author: dtb_
content: <@695886498733752340>, myself, and <@834543635587924028> were looking for access to a few different clients to compare trace APIs. I think <@695886498733752340> was specifically looking for access to a geth node ‚Äî correct?

author: hmrtn
content: That is correct. We have access to archive Nethermind and Erigon nodes and am looking for archive geth and Besu node access

author: ja_0001
content: I am installing geth but four full days and only 100G installed. I think that total is 200G. Correct ?

author: ja_0001
content: Besu and Erigon are the biggest one. Think so.

author: holiman
content: I can provide a non-archive, if you send me an ssh-key. I can check around for an archive node, but I don't have one handy

author: ja_0001
content: Hi Piper. Could you please share the list from this https://www.4byte.directory/ ? 239,764 I am struggling to get to the letter T. Regardless I will keep trying. I just found out you are the one that mapped. Thanks.

author: pipermerriam
content: You'll just have to scrape the API or find a copy that someone else has already scraped. I recall there being a github repo (maybe managed by <@333694584607604738> ) that had copies of the full list

author: ligi42
content: <@!364458974906548225> <@!834543635587924028> here it is: https://github.com/ethereum-lists/4bytes has even more entries than just from the directory - e.g. also from sourcify

author: ja_0001
content: Thanks. Please correct me if I‚Äôm wrong. Looks like there is just the 4bytes list. I need the hex number paired with the text signature. If there is not I will keep crawling. One more letter to go. If you find the list paired I would really appreciated. Thanks again.

author: ligi42
content: <@!834543635587924028> the repo contains both - the filename is the 4-byte - the content the text signature
